isis.stitle: DT 466 / DT 570 / HT 570 Diesel Engine Diagnostic Manual - 2004 Emissions with EGR - Hard Start and No Start Diagnostics - Test Procedures - 12. Main Power Relay to IDM

svcprocinfo.para: To determine correct power supplied to operate the IDM
The IDM requires 7 V minimum for correct operation.

svcsubproc.title: Voltage Measurement at 12-Pin Connection with Breakout Harness

item.para: 12-Pin Breakout Harness
Digital Multimeter (DMM)

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle, read all safety instructions in the "Safety Information" section of this manual.

note.para: Batteries must be fully charged before doing the following steps.

step1.para: Turn the ignition switch to OFF and ensure all accessories turned off.
Disconnect 12-pin connector above the ECM and IDM.

caution.para: When disconnecting the 12-pin connector, the lock can come loose. Put the lock back in the correct place before reconnecting the connector.

step1.para: Connect 12-pin Breakout Harness between both engine and chassis connectors.
Connect leads of the DMM to each of the following test points:

item.para: POS 12 to NEG 1 (IDM PWR to IDM GND)
POS 9 to NEG 1 (V IGN to IDM GND)
POS 9 to NEG 8 (V IGN to MPR)
POS 6 to NEG 1 (IDM Logic PWR to IDM GND)

step1.para: Crank engine for 20 seconds and measure voltage.
Record the lowest voltage on Diagnostic Form.

item.para:
If the voltage is below 7 V, the IDM main power relay may be resetting, resulting from low voltage and current from the batteries or problems in the ignition circuit or power feed circuits. See "IDM PWR, Injector Drive Module Power"
in Section 7.
If the voltage is above 7 V, continue with Hard Start And No Start diagnostic tests.

note.para: Results can be above 7 V, but there may be a problem between the 12-pin connector and the IDM. If a Hard Start / No Start problem remains after all Diagnostic Form tests are complete, check voltage at IDM connector.

item.para: Failed batteries
High-resistance at battery cable connections
Wiring to the IDM

randlist.title: Low or no battery voltage to the IDM main power relay

item.para: High-resistance or an open power feed circuit to the IDM or IDM main power relay.
The IDM power circuit fuse in battery box may be open.
IDM main power relay may have failed.
V IGN circuit problem
Failed IDM

svcsubproc.title: Voltage Measurement with Breakout Harness at Main Power Relay

note.para: This is an alternate procedure for any of the following:

item.para: A 12-pin Breakout Harness is not available
Expected voltages were not to spec, when using the 12-pin Breakout Harness
Relay Breakout Harness
Digital Multimeter (DMM)

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle, read all safety instructions in the "Safety Information" section of this manual.

note.para: Batteries must be fully charged before doing the following steps.

step1.para: Turn the ignition switch to OFF and ensure all accessories are turned off.
Connect Relay Breakout Harness between IDM main power relay and power distribution center or chassis harness depending on application.

note.para: Depending on application, the relay could be one of two kinds. Check power distribution center or cab cowl.

step1.para: Connect DMM POS lead to 87 and NEG to ground terminal on cowl.
Crank engine for 20 seconds and measure voltage.
Record the lowest voltage on Diagnostic Form.

item.para:
If the voltage is below 7 V, the IDM main power relay may be resetting, resulting from low voltage and current from the batteries or problems in the ignition circuit or power feed circuits. See "IDM PWR, Injector Drive Module Power"
in Section 7 .
If the voltage is above 7 V, continue with Hard Start and No Start tests.

note.para: Results can be above 7 V, but there may be a problem between the main power relay and IDM. If a Hard Start / No Start problem remains after all Diagnostic Form tests are complete, check voltage at 12-pin connector and IDM connector.
